categories.title: Hardware
categories.description: The physical gear that keeps my workflow fast and comfortable.

items.name: MacBook Pro 16" (M3 Max)
items.context: Primary workstation for development, design experiments, and long-form writing. I keep everything local for speed, relying on containerized dev environments when collaborating.

items.name: Apple Studio Display
items.context: External monitor tuned for color consistency. It gives me the pixels I need for Figma and gives breathing room when comparing product specs or code diffs side-by-side.

items.name: Keychron Q1 Pro
items.context: Favorite mechanical keyboard—hot-swappable and wireless. I rotate keycaps but keep a tactile feel to improve typing accuracy during long planning sessions.

items.name: Logitech MX Master 3S
items.context: Ergonomic mouse with app-specific profiles. I map the side scroll to scrub timelines in Descript and the thumb button for mission control to juggle research tabs.

categories.title: Development Toolkit
categories.description: Core software for building, testing, and shipping projects.

items.name: Cursor
items.context: Acts as my pair programmer. I lean on it for rapid prototyping, translating product ideas into working code, and refactoring legacy projects with confidence.

items.name: Warp Terminal
items.context: Command palette and AI command search speed up repetitive tasks. I save shared notebooks for infra automation that the rest of the team can reuse.

items.name: Raycast
items.context: Swiss army knife for quick actions—spins up project workspaces, triggers Linear issues, and fetches documentation snippets without leaving the keyboard.

items.name: Linear
items.context: Keeps product discovery aligned with delivery. I document hypotheses, capture experiments, and link outcomes directly to shipped features.

categories.title: Creative & Content
categories.description: Tools for writing, storytelling, and communicating ideas.

items.name: Notion
items.context: Holds project briefs, personal research, and parenting notes. Every new experiment starts here as a narrative before it becomes a roadmap or prototype.

items.name: Descript
items.context: My shortcut for walkthrough videos and feature announcements. Editing transcripts like a doc lets me iterate fast without touching a traditional timeline.

items.name: FigJam
items.context: Where messy ideas live first. I map out systems, customer journeys, and experiment flows here before turning them into specs or tickets.

categories.title: Wellbeing & Rituals
categories.description: Support systems that keep me grounded while building.

items.name: Eight Sleep Pod Cover
items.context: Sleep data meets comfort. Helps me dial in recovery so I can show up rested for deep work blocks and family time.

items.name: Day One Journal
items.context: End-of-day ritual to offload decisions, capture lessons, and stay present. I revisit entries weekly to spot patterns in energy and focus.

items.name: Calm
items.context: Short check-ins before shipping something stressful. Keeps pulse steady when juggling a launch and school drop-off logistics.
